paper.title: Practical Fast Searching in Strings

author.org: School of Computer Science, McGill University, 805 Sherbrooke Street West, Montreal, Quebec H3A 2K6, Canada

paper.abstract: SUMMARY The problem of searching through text to find a specified substring is considered in a practical setting. It is discovered that a method developed by Boyer and Moore can outperform even special-purpose search instructions that may be built into the, computer hardware. For very short substrings however, these special purpose instructions are fastest-provided that they are used in an optimal way.
